page.title: 03Farming In Jedburgh
page.content: The farms grow mainly cereals and grass.Barley is the main cereal and in recent years winter barley has taken the place of spring barley. On the grassland Blue Grey sucklers predominate.These are mated with Charolais bulls.Calves are sold fat <50%> or store.The sheep stocks are mainly Grey Face ewes. One farm in addition to cereals grows some vegetables .One of the larger farms has recently had a new owner and farming policy has completely changed.Most of the land has been sown down to cereals where as formerly it had cheviot sheep and suckler cows. Machinery is very up to date.Many traditional farm buildings still exist but in recent years many large cattle or multi_purpose sheds have been built
